New Records: The Dodgers are just the eighth team with consecutive games in the same World Series with five or more extra-base hits, and the first since Houston in Games 2-3 in 2017.
Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history to win Game 1
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history to win Game 1
Freddie Freeman homered in Game 2, making him just the seventh Dodger to homer in consecutive World Series games
The Dodgers kept both games close thanks in large part to very good starting pitching
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers offense is as big a reason as any that they are two wins away from a championship, hitting.248/.340/.451 with an MLB-best 121 wRC+, 24 home runs, and 6.15 runs per game this postseason
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge has struggled so far with six strikeouts and just one single in two games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers got home runs from Teoscar Hernández and Tommy Edman in Game 2
The other guys in LA’s lineup through two games are hitting.225/.256/.500 with six extra-base hits, four RBI, and five runs scored
Others: The Dodgers are now in New York, with Game 3 of the World Series at Yankee Stadium
